title: Woodford fund supervisor Link under fire for 'negligible' fee move
text:
The supervisor of Neil Woodford’s collapsed equity income fund has been criticised for waiving its fee and vowing to return left over money to investors after it emerged that spare cash would barely cover the costs of closing down the fund next year.

Link Fund Solutions immediately chose to waive its own fee to act as authorised corporate director after sacking Mr Woodford and announcing the closure of the gated fund last week, promising to return any left over money to investors as part of a liquidation process starting next year.

However, analysis conducted by The Telegraph found that Link has only earned a maximum of £250,000 since the fund’s gating in June, with that figure unlikely to...
description: The supervisor of Neil Woodford’s collapsed equity income fund has been criticised for waiving its fee and vowing to  return left over money to investors after it emerged that spare cash would barely cover the costs of closing down the fund next year.
